subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}} – a hand grabbing from above (in earlier forms from side); compare {{zh-l|*手}}, {{zh-l|*寸}}, {{zh-l|*九}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=zhuǎ,zhǎo,er=y,1nb=vernacular,2nb=literary
|m_note=zhuǎ - “claw; claw-like object”
|m-s=zao3
|c=zaau2
|h=pfs=cháu
|mn=ml:cháu/qz,xm,zz:chiáu/qz:liáu/tp,xm:niáu/kh,zz:jiáu
|mn_note=cháu - literary; chiáu/liáu/niáu/jiáu - vernacular
|mn-t=riao2/riou2
|mn-t_note=riao2 - Shantou; riou2 - Chaozhou
|w=2tsau
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n,pn
}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
* {{zh-l|爪}} ― paws or claws of vertebrates, except for humans, bears, ducks, geese and swans
* {{zh-l|鉗}} ― claws of arthropods (crabs, clawed lobsters, scorpions, etc.)
* {{zh-l|掌}} ― hands, paws or claws of humans (only in compounds), bears, ducks, geese or swans
* {{zh-l|手}} ― hands or hooves of humans or swines (only when swine hoof as a food)
* {{zh-l|蹄}} ― hooves
